str2: Of Hebrew origin; my master, i.e Rabbi, as an official title of honor.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
To stone, pelt with stones. From lithos; to lapidate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
